job description:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Responsible for clinical data management and analysis activities.

Analyzes clinical data by applying statistical principles.

Prepares clinical reports, tables, graphs for regulatory submissions

Contributes to creation of conference posters, abstracts, manuscripts.

Reviews clinical protocol, data management documentation, and develops and implements processes to ensure data integrity and completeness.

Maintain traceability of data sets used for data analysis.

Manages data cleaning process by communicating with site monitors.

Identifies and makes recommendations on trends in data discrepancies and executes steps to reconcile data

Manages quick-paced data processing and analysis timelines and communicates with team regarding data management action items

Performs other duties as assigned.

TECHNICAL AND COMMUNICATIVE SKILLS:

Excellent data management and analysis skills using SAS, MATLAB, R, Excel, Access.

Good understanding of statistics, clinical study design and trial methodology

Good understanding of ICH and FDA regulatory guidance and regulations

Strong organizational and documentation skills.

A team player with excellent communication and troubleshooting skills

Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic team

Basic project management and organizational skills

Attention to detail for data integrity activities.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Masters in Statistics or PhD in Bioengineering (or equivalent degree) with 1-2 relevant years' experience

Type:Temp/Contract to DirectLocation:Irvine
